thread.title_full: Dudley's Last-Second Shot Secures LA Tech's Victory Over Indiana State

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Dudley's Last-Second Shot Secures LA Tech's Victory Over Indiana State
text:
Dudley’s Last-Second Shot Secures LA Tech’s Victory Over Indiana State
DJ Dudley delivered a thrilling finish for Louisiana Tech, sinking a game-winning jumper with 1.4 seconds remaining to secure a 75-73 victory over Indiana State. The matchup saw a significant shift in offensive dynamics compared to the previous contest, with both teams exchanging leads in a high-scoring second half. The Bulldogs overcame an early deficit, closing the first half on a 19-1 run and later extending their lead into double digits. Ultimately, Dudley's clutch performance sealed the win, helping LA Tech avenge last week’s defeat and improve their record to 3-2.
By the Numbers- LA Tech shot 51.6% from the field, while Indiana State shot 52.7%.
- Five Bulldogs scored in double figures, the highest total this season.
- Dudley scored a season-high 17 points, leading the scoring.
- LA Tech recorded 55 points from the bench, the most in a single game this season.
- LA Tech improved their overall record to 3-2, bouncing back after a prior loss.
- The Bulldogs demonstrated resilience, coming back from a 25-18 deficit in the first half.
- The series between LA Tech and Indiana State is now tied at 2-2.
LA Tech is set to host Alcorn State on Saturday, November 29, aiming to solidify their home game record and build on their current momentum.
Bottom LineDudley’s performance highlights the Bulldogs’ potential, showcasing their ability to excel under pressure. With a solid showing from the bench and key contributions from various players, LA Tech demonstrates they are a formidable team moving forward.
